result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Allen Ressler

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

8:59 AM Defendant Anthony Allen Ressler appeared by video.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Anthony Allen Ressler.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 22CF317, 22TR2638, and 22TR2639. Court notes that cases are being called early and there are no victims. Attorney acknowledges receipt of the information, waives a formal reading, enters a plea of not guilty and requests a status. Defendant indicates he will be in treatment for another 45 days. Court sets status 60 days out. Parties are in agreement.
Status conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Anthony Allen Ressler
Current: 8730 Vinland Street, Duluth, MN 55810 United States  (Effective: 08-24-2022)
Prior: 1075 82Nd St W, Duluth, MN 55806
No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

1:31 PM Defendant Anthony Allen Ressler appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ryan Anthony Reid in court for Anthony Allen Ressler.  Prosecuting attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Reid provided updated address. Attorney Reid received complaint, waives reading and requests preliminary hearing. State requests $3,000 cash bail with condition of no use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. Defendant has prior record out of Minnesota with most recent fta's in April 2022 and August 2021 with several other failures to appear. There has been 5 failures to appear in last 18 months. Attorney Reid states defendant a lifelong resident of Duluth with local ties and requests a signature bond. Court orders $3,000 cash bail and condition of no use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.
